content: Lab Setup The Lab used in this analysis is composed of a Windows machine and a Remnux host. MarineGEO logo The default gateway on the windows machine is 192.168.234.129 Remnux has Inetsim, FakeDns and Wireshark configured and running. Remnux can intercept all incoming traffic.
title: My First Post

content: Static Analysis 1. Peframe Using Peframe, a non-common section name $u and few interesting API call have been identified. MarineGEO logo MarineGEO logo 2. PeStudio PeStudi was able to identify suspicious artifacts like the non-common, writable & executable section $u. The use of potentially suspicious Windows API functions and embedded file in section $u. MarineGEO logo MarineGEO logo MarineGEO logo MarineGEO logo 3. DIE Detect it easy, suggests that this malware is not packed. MarineGEO logo
title: My First Post

content: Behavioral Analysis 1. ProcDot analysis Below all the interactions done by the malware on the OS. MarineGEO logo Persistence method The malware sets the following run key: HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\bam\State\UserSettings\S-1-5-21-201960391-10506 06829-3220342080-1001\Device\HarddiskVolume3\Users\WindowsRM\Desktop\Samples\sampl e_gw.exe MarineGEO logo Dropper behavior The analyzed specimen, drops an executable file on the system and launch it Dropped filename: C:\411b3d06.exe MarineGEO logo This matches the observation using Process Hacker. MarineGEO logo The dropped file, creates and sets a new bat file. MarineGEO logo In addition, the dropped exe file, tries to bypass all proxy settings on the infected machine. MarineGEO logo Another observed interesting behavior, is the creation of 5 executable files under the TEMP folder. MarineGEO logo The dropped speciem, infects all the executable files on the host. MarineGEO logo 2. Network traffic analysis Right after executing the malware, a DNS request for the domain 1.dnsnb8[.]net was observed. MarineGEO logo In wireshark, TCP connections towards the same domain on port 799 was observed. After reconfiguring the TCP simulation on Inetsim to accept incoming traffic on port 799, wireshark was able to catch HTTP requests to download .rar files. MarineGEO logo The malware was aiming to drop the following files: http://1.dnsnb8[.]net:799/cj/k1.rar http://1.dnsnb8[.]net:799/cj/k2.rar http://1.dnsnb8[.]net:799/cj/k3.rar http://1.dnsnb8[.]net:799/cj/k4.rar http://1.dnsnb8[.]net:799/cj/k5.rar This was confirmed by Inetsim reports MarineGEO logo Fiddler client on the windows host was able to catch the same HTTP traffic: MarineGEO logo These 5 rar files could be linked to the 5 executables generated by the dropped specimen C:\411b3d06.exe
title: My First Post

content: Dynamic Analysis During a brief analysis using x32gdb debugger, the behavior of the malware has been confirmed. The created of the file with the name 411b3d06.exe has been observed at runtime. MarineGEO logo The specimen was observed checking its original filename and compare it to Remove. If the file is called Remove.exe, the malware will display a message box to the user saying: “This program is normally started by windows”. If not, the program will just display “Setup program invalid or damaged”. MarineGEO logo The filename has no impact on the behavior of the malware.
title: My First Post
